title: Uncomfortable and significant lag
text: I bought these headphones to use with my laptop at home. I wanted something I could use to watch videos, game, and to stream audiobooks/music while doing jobs around the house. These headphones had great reviews, but unfortunately weren't for me and have been returned.PROS:* The sound quality is great. I'm certainly no audiophile and had been using a pair of very basic falling-apart wired earphones held together by tape immediately before buying these. However, they seemed crisp and clear, whether for videos or music.* They look really nice for the price. They feel well-made and don't look like a budget option.CONS:* There is a significant lag when watching videos. I've had quite a few wireless headphones and earbuds over the years and never experienced lag as bad as this. I tried restarting them, disconnecting and reconnecting, resetting to factory settings. Nothing helped. Much cheaper wireless earbuds bought the same day had a barely noticeable lag. Ultimately, this made the headphones unusable for me, as it was just too distracting trying to watch a TV show with this degree of lag.* I have a small head and they still felt very tight against my ears. After just a few minutes, they made my ears feel sore. I do have quite prominent cartilage in my ears and have had issues when wearing headphones for long periods in the past, but usually after hours rather than minutes. There's quite a bit of padding around the edge, but my ears were still jammed hard against the middle unpadded part. Again, headphones that I can't wear for more than a few minutes are unusable headphones for me.* To be sure when you have turned the headphones on or off or changed settings, you need to have the headphones on so that you can hear the responses. However, the buttons aren't very ergonomic and I struggled to know if I was feeling the right one without taking the headphones off and looking. This might improve with longer use, but could easily have been avoided by making the buttons a little more prominent, or utilising taps like most other modern headphones.Ultimately, these could still be a great choice if you want headphones primarily for listening to music or audio-books and you have nice flat ears. But they aren't really suitable for watching videos/gaming unless you can tolerate a lot of lag, and they are horrible to wear if you have delicate ears like mine!

title: On Ear Headphone Works Well For Casual Listening & Some Sport/Fitness Activities
text: Ordered the Sony WH-CH520 Wireless Bluetooth Headphones for my wife as a gift for Mothers Day as she is unable to wear earbuds due to her ear canal being so small. I looked around for a nice, branded budget pair and snapped these up when they became available. They were packaged in a typical brand retail format cardboard container with a loop on the top for hanging on a store rack, the outer sleeve comes off when the securing tab is unhooked, revealing a fairly plain but branded box within. Inside the box were the on-ear headphones (in white as selected) wrapped in a white cloth reminiscent of a thick tissue paper, a charging cable and user booklet ‚Äì no additional packaging plastics which is to be commended. No case is provised with this model of headphone.The headphones are very lightweight though feel well built, the cups have good cushioning in the pads and in the headband and as such they are super comfortable to wear. The controls are all in the right cup only and consist of the on/off/Bluetooth pairing button and volume up/down buttons which also act as skip forward and backward, the cups are marked for L and R just above them on the headband.In terms of use and sound, these are on-ear as stated and as such do not present much in the way of noise isolation and can come loose with moderate/intense body/head movement from the wearer but that is common for the on-ear type of headphone. In use, battery life is long at 50 hours and they also have the ability to perform multi-pairing, which works well, as does the sony App which allows customisation of the sound EQ etc. Clamping force is OK, controls are pretty standard but function well, and as for the sound signature I‚Äôd say a tendency to a warm sound, with very good and accurate bass and mid-range though distortion is presented when volume is pushed higher, the treble is less well defined, soundstage is slightly below average. The microphone is pretty good actually with clear reproduction ‚Äì though the background noise reproduction is average. I would say that their Bluetooth performance is very good at this price point, though they have no gaming support capability as there is no jack, the USB C port is for charging only. Overall then a mixed bag but they are perfect for the intended purpose and as such I‚Äôm giving them 4 out of 5 stars.

Aber es gibt zum Beispiel noch die M√∂glichkeit, die Kopfh√∂rer √ºber die App gleichzeitig mit zwei Quellen √ºber Bluetooth zu verbinden. Das ist schon toll. Ruft mich jemand auf dem iPhone an, kann ich das Gespr√§ch mit diesem Kopfh√∂rer annehmen, obwohl ich bis gerade Musik √ºber das iPad oder den Computer geh√∂rt habe.Und der grunds√§tzliche Sound dieser Kopfh√∂rer ist gut, wenn auch nicht vergleichbar mit hochwertigen Kopfh√∂rern f√ºr den Klassikliebhaber. Die B√§sse hier sind akzentuiert aber nicht aufdringlich, die H√∂hen sehr fein und deutlich, die Mitten recht ausgewogen. Und wem das in den Grundeinstellungen nicht gef√§llt, hat ja die M√∂glichkeit, mit dem Equalizer in der App, seine Lieblingseinstellungen zu finden.Ich finde diesen Bluetooth-Kopfh√∂rer f√ºr den Preis von 60 Euro gut. Dem Ger√§t f√ºr sich gesehen gebe ich 4 Sterne, weil es einen guten Sound bei leichtem Gewicht und guter Verarbeitungsqualit√§t bietet. Die Vorteile, die man durch die Verwendung der App haben k√∂nnte, werden durch die Registrierungspflicht und die Beschr√§nkung auf bestimmte Streamingdienste wieder aufgehoben.
